page.title: 01Area East of Harwood Dale
page.content: The block is predominantly large coniferous plantations and arable farmland with some deciduous woodland, mainly along streams. The A171 passes through the block, and a few country roads. Apart from the small village of Harwood Dale in the west the block has just a scattering of farms and houses. Is in National Park with pleasant rolling hills so appeals to tourists who drive through, visit the village with its picturesque church, or walk in the countryside. The north east is more hilly with Haybarn Beck and deciduous woods and seems to attract more visitors than the flatter more open south & west areas, which are overlooked by large flat topped forested hills to the west. Residents who live outside Harwood Dale nearly all appear to be involved in farming, and forestry.
